title: These / Those
description: Слушайте и определяйте, о ближних или дальних предметах идёт речь.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at a fruit shop. She points at apples near her. These apples look very fresh.

options.text: The apples near her look fresh.
The apples far away look fresh.
All apples in the shop look fresh.
The apples near her look old.

tasks.explanation: 'These' refers to things close to the speaker. The apples near her look fresh. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A boy stands at the window. He looks at birds in a far tree. Those birds are very colorful.

options.text: The birds near the boy are colorful.
The birds far away are colorful.
The birds near the boy are small.
The birds far away are noisy.

tasks.explanation: 'Those' refers to things far from the speaker. The birds in the far tree are colorful. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A girl is at a bookshop. She holds two books in her hands. These books are for my brother.
tasks.transcript: These books are for my brother.

options.text: The books in her hands are for her brother.
The books on the shelf are for her brother.
The books in her hands are for her sister.
The books in her hands are for herself.

tasks.explanation: 'These books' — she is holding them, so they are close. They are for her brother. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A man is at a car show. He points across the room. Those cars over there are very expensive.
tasks.transcript: Those cars over there are very expensive.

options.text: The cars close to him are expensive.
The cars across the room are cheap.
The cars across the room are expensive.
All the cars are the same price.

tasks.explanation: 'Those cars over there' — 'those' plus 'over there' means far away. They are expensive. Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A teacher holds papers in her hands. She shows them to the class. These are your test results.

options.text: The papers in her hands are test results.
The papers on the desk are test results.
The papers in her hands are homework.
The papers on the wall are test results.

tasks.explanation: 'These' means close — the papers she holds. They are test results. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A family is at the zoo. A boy looks at animals behind a fence. Those monkeys are so funny!

options.text: The monkeys near the boy are sad.
The monkeys at a distance are funny.
The monkeys near the boy are funny.
The monkeys at a distance are scary.

tasks.explanation: 'Those monkeys' — they are behind a fence, at a distance. They are funny. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at a bakery. She looks at cakes on the counter in front of her. These cakes smell wonderful.

options.text: The cakes near her smell wonderful.
The cakes in the back smell wonderful.
The cakes near her taste wonderful.
The cakes near her look old.

tasks.explanation: 'These cakes' are close to the speaker, on the counter. They smell wonderful. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A man sits on a park bench. He sees tall buildings far away. Those buildings are new offices.

options.text: The buildings close to him are new offices.
The buildings far away are old apartments.
The buildings far away are new offices.
The buildings near him are shops.

tasks.explanation: 'Those buildings' — far away from the speaker. They are new offices. Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A girl shows her mother some photos on her phone. They sit together. These photos are from my trip.
tasks.transcript: These photos are from my trip.

options.text: The photos on the phone are from her trip.
The photos on the wall are from her trip.
The photos on the phone are from her mother's trip.
The photos in the album are from her trip.

tasks.explanation: 'These photos' — on her phone, close to her. They are from the girl's trip. Option 1.

tasks.audioText: A boy and his friend are at the beach. The friend points at distant boats. Those boats are fishing boats.

options.text: The boats near the shore are fishing boats.
The distant boats are sailing boats.
The distant boats are fishing boats.
The boats near the shore are fast.

tasks.explanation: 'Those boats' — far away, distant. They are fishing boats. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman picks up two boxes from the floor. They are heavy. These boxes go to the storage room.
tasks.transcript: These boxes go to the storage room.

options.text: The boxes in her hands go to the office.
The boxes far away go to the storage room.
The boxes in her hands go to the storage room.
The boxes in her hands go to the kitchen.

tasks.explanation: 'These boxes' — she is holding them, so they are close. They go to storage. Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A man looks at mountains from his hotel balcony. They are far away. Those mountains have snow on top.
tasks.transcript: Those mountains have snow on top.

options.text: The nearby hills have snow.
The far mountains have snow on their peaks.
The far mountains have trees on top.
The nearby mountains have no snow.

tasks.explanation: 'Those mountains' — far away from the balcony. They have snow on top. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A girl is at a market. She picks up some strawberries from a basket. These strawberries are very sweet.

options.text: The strawberries in her hand are sour.
The strawberries far away are sweet.
The strawberries in her hand are sweet.
The strawberries in her hand are expensive.

tasks.explanation: 'These strawberries' — she is holding them, so they are close. They are sweet. Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A boy looks at stars in the sky with his father. The night is clear. Those stars are so bright tonight.
tasks.transcript: Those stars are so bright tonight.

options.text: The stars far away in the sky are bright.
The lights nearby are bright.
The stars are not visible tonight.
The stars are dim tonight.

tasks.explanation: 'Those stars' — far away in the sky. They are bright tonight. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at a clothing store. She holds two shirts. These shirts are perfect for the summer.
tasks.transcript: These shirts are perfect for the summer.

options.text: The shirts she holds are perfect for winter.
The shirts on the rack are perfect for summer.
The shirts she holds are perfect for summer.
The shirts far away are perfect for summer.

tasks.explanation: 'These shirts' — she is holding them. They are perfect for summer. Option 3.

short_description: Тренируйте различение these и those на слух.
